org.apache.gora.persistency.impl

Class PersistentBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.avro.specific.SpecificRecordBase
      • org.apache.gora.persistency.impl.PersistentBase
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Externalizable, Serializable, Comparable<org.apache.avro.specific.SpecificRecord>, org.apache.avro.generic.GenericContainer, org.apache.avro.generic.GenericRecord, org.apache.avro.generic.IndexedRecord, org.apache.avro.specific.SpecificRecord, Dirtyable, Persistent

    public abstract class PersistentBase
extends org.apache.avro.specific.SpecificRecordBase
implements Persistent, Externalizable
    Base classs implementing common functionality for Persistent classes.
    See Also:

      • getDirtyBytes

        public ByteBuffer getDirtyBytes()
        Exposing dirty bytes over public method. Purpose is to preserve dirty bytes content while transporting AVRO data beans over TCP wire in serialized form. Since PersistentBase implements Externalizable, this method can be used to retrieve the dirty bytes as ByteBuffer and and get the content as bytes[] and write byte stream to the TCP wire. See Externalizable.writeExternal(ObjectOutput) abstract method implementation on velocity template record.vm.

        Note ByteBuffer is not itself not in serializable form.

        Returns:
        __g__dirty dirty bytes

      • setDirtyBytes

        public void setDirtyBytes(ByteBuffer __g__dirty)
        Setter method for assign dirty bytes when deserializing AVRO bean from dirty bytes preserved in serialized bytes form. Since PersistentBase implements Externalizable and when actual deserialization happens for PersistentBase new instance, acquire byte stream from TCP wire, extracting specific byte[] from byte stream and create ByteBuffer instance and set using this public method. See Externalizable.readExternal(ObjectInput) abstract method implementation on velocity template record.vm.

        Note Externalizable extending means it is mandatory to have default public constructor.

        Parameters:
        __g__dirty - dirty bytes

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Description copied from interface: Persistent
        Clears the inner state of the object without any modification to the actual data on the data store. This method should be called before re-using the object to hold the data for another result.
        Specified by:
        clear in interface Persistent
